subject: Baseball
Human Growth Hormone
lead_paragraph: Mike Lowell, the most valuable player of the World Series, said he was willing to give blood if that is what it takes to be tested for human growth hormone — but only if the test is 100 percent accurate. “If it’s 99 percent accurate, that’s going to be seven false positives,” Lowell said Thursday before the annual dinner of the Boston chapter of the Baseball Writers’ Association of America. “Ninety-three percent is 70 guys. That’s almost three whole rosters. You’re destroying someone’s reputation. What if one of the false positives is Cal Ripken? Doesn’t it put a black mark on his career?”.
